p: As of now no validated vaccines or antiviral drugs against SARS-CoV-2 infection exist ( 7), the hospital in our country have provided and establish dedicated areas (e.g., waiting rooms) for cancer patients. Preventive measures have been doubled by implementing active-surveillance that allows cases to be identified earlier, isolating them according to appropriate management and containment procedures. Another measure to reduce contagion of vulnerable patients was to postpone visits for non-urgent cancer patients. This however, poses the question on how to best follow patients in their homes ( 8, 9). Finally in order to change the clinical practice for oncologic patients in terms of assistance and controls, a multidisciplinary team is needed to improve the diagnostic and therapeutic management for cancer patients ( 10).
